凡.definition: ordinary; commonplace; mundane; temporal; of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels); every; all; whatever; altogether; gist; outline; note of Chinese musical scale

凡例.definition: notes on the use of a book; guide to the reader

凡俗.definition: lay (as opposed to clergy); ordinary; commonplace

凡塵.definition: mundane world (in religious context); this mortal coil

凡夫.definition: common person; ordinary guy; mortal man

凡心.definition: reluctance to leave this world; heart set on the mundane

凡是.definition: each and every; every; all; any

凡爾賽.definition: Versailles (near Paris); (slang) to humblebrag; ostensibly modest, but in fact boastful

凡爾賽文學.definition: (slang) social media post whose purpose is to humblebrag

凡響.definition: ordinary tones; everyday harmony; common chord

凡高.definition: Vincent Van Gogh (1853-1890), Dutch post-Impressionist painter
